weekly_top_story.headline: Medicare to Restrict Telehealth Services Starting October 1, 2025
weekly_top_story.summary: Medicare will require patients to be in a rural office or medical facility for most telehealth services from October 1, 2025, significantly restricting virtual care access and potentially impacting millions of patients and providers nationwide.

stories.headline: Federal Shutdown Threatens Funding for 1,500 Community Health Centers
stories.summary: The government shutdown starting October 1, 2025, risks severe financial challenges for federally funded health centers serving low-income populations, potentially forcing staff cuts, service reductions, or closures with increased strain on hospital emergency rooms.

stories.headline: Phelps Health Plans $60M Expansion to Double Emergency Room Size in Rural Missouri
stories.summary: Amid closures of rural hospitals, Phelps Health in Rolla, Missouri, is investing $60 million to double its emergency room size with enhanced facilities, aiming to improve rural healthcare access and capacity by 2027.
